ui.brandSub: tools for generating and editing maps
ui.legalHtml:
Legal information. This page is provided “as is”, without any warranties. You use it at your own risk.

Third-party tools. Generators may be based on or inspired by third-party projects. Please comply with their licenses and attribution requirements.

Privacy. The page intentionally does not collect personal data. Your selected language is stored locally in the browser (localStorage) to remember your choice.
ui.pwaInstallUnsupported: Installation isn't supported in this browser.
ui.pwaInstallIOSHint: iPhone/iPad: Share → Add to Home Screen
ui.pwaInstallIOSToast: iPhone/iPad: open “Share” and choose “Add to Home Screen”

cave.title: Cave/Glade Generator
cave.short: A “one-page dungeon” analogue for natural sites: caves, burrows, or forest clearings.
desc: The generator was conceived as a natural analogue of a one-page dungeon. Using the same approach, you can get a network of cavern chambers or a cluster of connected forest glades.
Many settings are available via context menus. Exports to PNG/SVG are supported.
features: Two render modes: cave and glade.

dwellings.title: Dwellings Generator
dwellings.short: Residential buildings from huts to mansions and small castles—focused on sensible floor plans.
desc: Generates homes from simple huts to multi-story mansions and small castles. The focus is on readable plans where most rooms have a purpose (kitchen, armory, etc.), plus an exterior view mode.
Export floor plans and elevations to PNG/SVG, as well as markup in JSON/PROTO.
features: Up to 8 floors (+ optional basement), connected by stairs.
Blueprint editor to define the first-floor shape.
PNG/SVG export for floor plans and elevations.
Export the layout schema to JSON/PROTO.

village.title: Village Generator
village.short: Villages are built around roads: fewer houses than in Medieval Fantasy City, more fields and trees.
desc: Unlike Medieval Fantasy City, the settlement is shaped by roads. Houses are spaced farther apart along winding paths, and fields and trees give the map a distinctly rural feel.
Export as an image to PNG/SVG, as well as markup in JSON/PROTO.
features: Several terrain setups with bridges/piers when needed.
Elevation shown with hatching and shadows.

mfcg.title: Medieval Fantasy City Generator
mfcg.short: A customizable medieval city layout with lots of options and exports (PNG/SVG/JSON/PROTO).
desc: MFCG is the most mature tool in the set: it has evolved from simple “city-like” layouts into more detailed and realistic maps with many parameters.
Many options are available via the context menu.
Export as an image to PNG/SVG, as well as markup in JSON/PROTO.
features: Control of required elements (walls, river, etc.).

viewer.title: City Viewer
viewer.short: A 3D viewer: import JSON/PROTO from generators, or cycle through random views.
desc: This is a viewer. You can open a specific city or village directly from MFCG or Village, but for new content you typically need to generate a city/village, export JSON/PROTO, and import it here.
Viewer options are available via the context menu.

introHtml:
This page is a compact hub for several procedural generators of maps and floor plans. The idea is simple: open a tool, quickly get a result, tweak parameters if needed, and export it for any purpose.

Why a separate hub? When you work with multiple generators, it’s easier to have a single entry point with clear descriptions, a unified style, and fast access to exports—in one place, in one style, and fully compatible with each other.

Key info:

  • Quickly sketch a variant with Enter (“regenerate”).
  • Change style/labels/settings via the context menu (right‑click or long‑press on mobile).
  • Export to PNG/SVG; JSON/PROTO is needed for the 3D viewer or third‑party tools.
  • Example workflow: make a village and detail a specific house with the floor‑plan generator.

This page started as a weekend hobby; all generators are written by watabou, and the improvements and consolidation into a single page were done by sunsung
